review.reviewBody:
I now have 2 pair in this style, plus 1 pair of Bravada boots, and it has become my favorite style of all the Merrell’s I have owned in the last 15 years. I moved over to Merrell from ASICS because my foot was getting wider, and their shoes became too narrow. 
These Merrell’s do not disappoint, and I can wear this shoe out of the box for a day on my feet, with NO break in time at all. In the medium width, in my regular size (10.5), there is plenty of width and give in the right toe box for my big toe bunion. Not only that, the lace area does not cut across the bunion at all, so it is comfortable and does not rub! It’s smooth!  I don’t have a bunion area on my left foot. There is also room in this shoe for my custom orthotics, when I remove the inner sole that comes with the shoe. Win win! Huge! 
They have the right amount of “cushion” for hiking trails here in NC mountains, as well as walking a lot. 
One more thing, these shoes actually look stylish, and not clunky, like a lot of shoes with this much support do. I also like that these shoes don’t have that huge built up heel that makes you 3” taller, like walking in Dansko’s (which I wore back in my medical days. I’m not a fan of the “rocker” soles.
So, as you can see, I’m a really happy camper - so Merrell, PLEASE don’t change these, and keep making the fun colors, and keep having sales! I’m going to buy another pair!
review.name: MY FAVORITE MERRELL STYLE EVER!
comment: We absolutely love your amazing review. Thank you!

review.reviewBody: I love the look of these shoes but it seems like there is extra material under the sho laces. My feet are a bit slender and by the time that I tied them there was a fold in the material under the shoe laces that rubbed the top of my foot. I had to stop wearing them due to the discomfort.
review.name: Loved the shoes but…

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe in the blue colors 8 months ago and have worn them almost every day since then. I bought them for a trip to Greece and Italy and my feet never hurt during the miles of walking. I love the tongue which allows me to stretch it enough to slip my foot in without untying and retying. The wide width is perfect for my jammer toe and bunion issues. I love walking in these every day.
review.name: Wonderful walking and hiking shoe!
comment: Thank you for the great feedback!

review.reviewBody: These are perfect for any type of exercise especially walking or running.
review.name: Nice and very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Just what I was looking for -- lightweight, comfortable out of the box, good support for lots of walking in the neighborhood and on trails.  I  like the design, the blue color and red/blue laces.
review.name: The best for walking
comment: We value your feedback tremendously.

review.reviewBody: I need a large, comfortable toe box and this shoe has it. I walked all over italy with them and never had an issue.
review.name: Nice toe box

review.reviewBody: The tongue on this sneaker does not move much so It's a push and pull to get it on my foot. Not happy with shoe design. The material catches lint.  Have owned more than a dozen Merrell over the years. This one is a bust for me.
review.name: First time not happy

review.reviewBody: Comfortable sneaker, good for walking, wearing all day and easy hikes. Very wide at the 'bunion' area - tho they can be tightened here - but still wide.
review.name: Comfortable Out of the Box

review.reviewBody: Well made and light weight. As soon as they arrived I put them on. They look exactly like the ones advertised. Bright colors and black n white shoe laces. I walk every day to exercise and be outside. I my hike is over 2 miles that includes rocks, sand and hills. I found theses shoes perfect for all those terrains.
review.name: My new walking shoes

review.reviewBody: Great fit. Great support during long days that involve standing all day.
review.name: Great shoe

name: Bravada 2 Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I have an older pair, and love them.  Still holding together after thousands of miles.  Just the velcro is losing it's grab.
But these newer one's...
The medium feels like a mislabled small.
The grippy pads on the fingers are falling off on 2nd ride.
review.name: not the same anymore?

review.reviewBody: Not enduro at all, index finger became unstitched after 3 rides, crap
review.name: POC Resistance Enduro Glove

review.reviewBody: Bought a pair of these a 6 months ago, and the the seam between the palm and the nose-wipe portion of the glove is already separating.  I have other brands of gloves that have lasted years longer. Disappointed.   Also, it never functioned well with touchscreens in my experience.  I usually had to remove my glove to operate my phone.
review.name: Not durable

review.reviewBody: Got these for my husband based off the reviews and they did not let me down! They are simple, breathable and have great flex. Another POC product we love!
review.name: Bought as a gift

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: I LOVE Patagonia’s Capiline Cool line of shirts so thought this would be the same. I’m sure it’s in the description somewhere how this one is different but I missed it. This one is a much scratchier material - not the super comfortable and smooth material in all of my other Capiline Cool shirts and long sleeves. This one is also much longer so it either sticks out or needs to be tucked in.
review.name: Different than other Capiline Cool products

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: Size is Too small. The actual color looks not good. I don't really like it.
review.name: Too small

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: I hesitated to buy this because it’s made of polyester and has a large logo on the back.  I was pleasantly surprised how cool it is while still offering sun protection.  Odor is under control as well.  It is my go to shirt for hiking and cycling.
review.name: Great for outdoor use

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've been eyeing these shirts for a while but the color/print was never my style until I saw the Sunfade Pink! I've only worn it as a casual shirt so far but I savor it when I do because the fabric is so soft. Sometimes the Patagonia Capilene Cool shirts with similar material get smelly easily; I haven't encountered it with this product yet but I haven't sweat much in it yet :)
review.name: So soft! Love the Sunfade Pink color

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: What a great shirt! It was so soft and so comfortable to wear. It kept me dry during my hike. The weather was a little cool but the shirt did it’s thing. It was a perfect shirt for what I needed it for and I really like the color.
review.name: So soft & so comfortable!

name: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's

review.reviewBody:
TLDR: they reduce high frequency vibrations, have a snug form fit that quickly conforms, great value, simple gloves. Can't yet comment on longevity

I have gloves for off road riding but, on drop bars they bunch up between my thumb and forefinger so they are super uncomfortable.

I decided to try these Jag gloves to reduce the numbness caused by vibrations going over chip seal here in South SF Bay. I like to ideally not wear gloves at all but it's too uncomfortable even on an old Trek Domane with carbon fork and 28c tubeless tires.

They fit very tight at first but, within 15 minutes, they relaxed and nicely conformed to my hands without bunching up.  On the hoods and the drops they stay snug enough to the hands that I have a really confident feel. The pads do reduce the reach of my fingers to the brifters (compared to barehanding it like I am used to) but I adapted quick and the comfort is worth that trade off.

They nearly eliminated the finger numbness that a particularly large grained chip seal road reliably caused prior. Overall, noticeable improvement in comfort without interfering much with having a good grip on the bars while navigating steep, twisty downhill.

Only 2 hours on them so durability is an open question.
review.name: Good vs chip seal vibrations

name: JAG Glove

review.itemreviewed: Sandy River II Printed 6in Short - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought a 2x and they were huge. Glad I didn’t order the suggested 3x. Do not size up for these. I almost think a 1 x may be too big as well. I usually wear a 16/18.  They are going back. 
Great fabric for hot weather.
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Sandy River II Printed 6in Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: These shorts run small- I bought a 2X and it fits nothing like all of my other 2X shorts from Columbia, honestly it felt more like a XL- almost 2 sizes smaller than I need.  Also the fabric is scratchy, has no stretch and the colors are not the same in person as they are in the photos online. Very disappointed and will be giving them to a friend who does not wear plus sizes.
review.name: Runs very small & fabric is scratchy

review.itemreviewed: Sandy River II Printed 6in Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: love the shorts, very comfortable , light and airy...probably could have went smaller but plenty of room to be comfy!!!!
review.name: LOVE THEM

review.itemreviewed: Sandy River II Printed 6in Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shorts are perfect for summer, lightweight, two roomy side pockets, wash well, dry quickly and nice fabric that can be worn at home or out. I loved them so much I ordered more twice!!
review.name: Comfy and lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Sandy River II Printed 6in Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Drawstring inside waistband ensures a comfortable fit when lounging outside the water, but can be tied nice and tight for swimming or playing. Quick dry. The waistband has a little give but the fabric does not stretch.
review.name: Great beach shorts!

review.itemreviewed: Sandy River II Printed 6in Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Shorts are comfortable and true to size. Great for the outdoors.
review.name: Great shorts

review.itemreviewed: Sandy River II Printed 6in Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice fit, pretty colors, just right to wear in Hawaii.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: Love them. Not quite as wide a field as the goggles they replace, but the magnetic catch system is a huge upgrade. Thank you Smith Optics
review.name: Love them. Not quite as

review.reviewBody: I purchased the IO Mag XL as I needed new goggles, wanted something magnetic as well as a model that would fit over glasses. They are new and magnetic, but they do not fit over my glasses. For the record, my glasses are a mid-size frame and fit easily into my older pair of Smith's that are an OTG model. It's time to return and shop again.
review.name: IO Mag XL don't necessarily fit over glasses.

review.reviewBody:
I am an expert skier with 10 years of ski patrol experience. I purchased a set of I/O Mag XL’s to try. I had a failure problem with one of the lenses and Smith stood by there product replacing the problem lense and ensuring I was satisfied. 

I would highly recommend Smith as a product to use for any skier/boarder level.
review.name: SMITH STANDS BY THEIR PRODUCT!!

review.reviewBody: I bought this goggle for a trip out west in March so I have not actually used it in the dull gray northeast. The main reason I gave it a 3 rating is for the fit of the goggle over eyewear. Most eyewear has gotten larger over the last few years and it seems your I/O XL does not fit well over these new size frames. I would highly recommend that you give a description of what size glasses your goggles will accommodate. Frames are measured in millimeters from end point to end point and width across the lens area.
review.name: New glasses don't fit in XL

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable over my glasses, didn’t fog, overall very happy with these!
review.name: Very comfortable over my glasses,

review.reviewBody: I love the goggles, they fit great and let me see the slopes very well. I would like to see a label on the lenses telling me which lens is which. This would help me to determine, which one to ware.
review.name: Label the lenses

review.reviewBody:
Great goggles!
Field of vision, fit, land looks are all typical Smith, awesome !!
review.name: Great goggles! Field of vision,

review.reviewBody: It is uncomfortable to wear these goggles with my glasses because of how the foam gasket presses on the temples. That was the main reason that I bought the goggles, so I'm disappointed about that. They are otherwise well made, and the magnetic locking system works much better than the old I/O system. The Rose Flash photochromatic lens works well.
review.name: Doesn't fit comfortably over my glasses.

review.reviewBody:
The fit seems better for narrow or smaller faces, despite being a larger rx-compatible model. It just barely fits over my glasses.
Field of view is just okay. Clarity is fantastic with good contrast and little distortion. The photo chromic lens works well and looks great.
review.name: Good enough

review.reviewBody: Good pair of goggles. Nice fit. Rarely fogs up and super clear lens.
review.name: Good pair of goggles. Nice

name: I/O MAG XL ChromaPop Goggles

review.reviewBody: I have used this several times and it has worked very well. Good controls and light weight.
review.name: Great tube style device

review.reviewBody: It works great and it is indeed lighter than my BD ATC. No complaints.
review.name: Great belay device

review.reviewBody: Very light and works well in guide mode

Love it. Works great with my 9.9 60m rope and has been through quite a lot. Still holds up very nicely! My friend always comments that the colors (purple/green) remind him of candy...whatever gets you through the climb bro.

Put it through hell and back belaying 80-90 people a week all summer (for work) on dirty ropes. Not a single edge. MY BD XP started getting an edge after just a few times on the same rope. Never used the guide portion of it, so I can't say much about it. But it is very light and not clunky like some guide devices. the only issue was if the ropes swelled up due to water (i think the rope was close to 11 mm, pretty thick) id have to switch devices because rope would go through. My friends say it reminds them of the hulk (i have the purple/green one). I recommend!

name: Pro Guide Lite Belay Device

review.reviewBody: The fabric seems great, but the fit on this jersey is just weird.  Length is very short compared to width.  I figured the size XXL would be a bit wide on me, but it ended up being both billowy and way (way) too short.  The elastic band at the waist seems designed to grip shorts, but if it slips, the stretch and (lack of) length of the jersey makes it into a sort of crop top for anyone with an actual torso.
review.name: Weirdest fitting garment I've purchased
comment: I have the long sleeve version and couldn't agree more. I'm not an "all torso" guy but this thing is borderline half shirt. I have the XL and normally wear a Large. It's not noticeable hunched over riding but don't get off the bike, unless you want to show some harry bellybutton.

name: RBX Adventure Jersey - Men's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Moji R + Lantern online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Moji R + Lantern
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Moji R + Lantern online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for my girlfriends first backpacking trip. When I got it and looked it over absolutely love it compared to my hammock lantern so I'm getting another one today
review.name: Purchasing a second one

review.reviewBody:
I got this lantern primarily for use in the back of my truck camper. It's smaller than expected, which was a cool bonus! It looks like the older Moji lanterns were probably larger based on reviews I've seen.

This is so small I will actually be able to take it backpacking and bikepacking as well, if I'm willing to sacrifice a bit of weight on that trip.

As far as light and features, the brightest setting completely lights up my camper as intended. The dimming feature is super easy and still provides great light.

Switching the solid color mode has a bit of a learning curve, but this little light is so cool and fun you won't mind spending time playing with it!

The hooks feel very strong compared to the weight, there is no concern at all about it falling when hanging.

Great little light from Black Diamond!
review.name: Awesome little lantern

review.reviewBody: The ideal ultra-light lantern to bring along. The youngsters enjoy the bright and cozy settings
review.name: Ultra

review.reviewBody: This little light is great. Awesome color and mood lighting and rechargeable too! Love the magnet for sticking it places.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Perfect ultra light lantern to pack with. Bright and the kids like the campfire setting.
review.name: Fun

review.reviewBody: Small, light and plenty bright. Great little camping/travel light.
review.name: Tiny, bright & mighty

review.reviewBody: This light is quite impressive for its size--small enough to fit in a pocket, and bright enough to light a small area. If there was a downside, it would be not having usb-c for charging. Still using the old micro-usb.
review.name: Great compact light

review.reviewBody: Good lantern for backpacking, smaller than I thought it would be. Love that uts rechargeable!
review.name: MOJO R

review.reviewBody: Small, compact, rechargeable, and lots of programable settings
review.name: Fantastic Rechargeable small lamp

review.reviewBody: This was an impulse purchase, but glad I bought it! I’m the envy of all my friends who now want one too! It’s such a cute little light with SO much power and functions!! I’ve used it camping and have clipped it to the from of my SUP for nightime paddling where a light is required by DNR. Great purchase, lots of uses for it!
review.name: This was an impulse purchase,

name: Moji R + Lantern

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and excellent for miles of walking. Newest pair is a darker look than my first which my wife says is more versatile. I use an orthotic insert for custom arch support and to keep plantar fasciitis at bay.
review.name: My second pair of Cliftons

review.reviewBody: After ordering a pair, I was amazed by the immediate comfort-they feel like walking on clouds, and the arch and heel support is perfect. I love the upgrades from the 8th version, and after trying one pair, I bought another in the wide version. These shoes are fantastic for daily wear or easy runs.
review.name: From Daily Wear to Easy Runs

review.reviewBody: these are by far the best walking shoes I ever tried on after the first eight hours. I felt no pain fast-forward to 20 hours on my feet. No pain.
review.name: Best shoes ever!!!!!!

review.reviewBody: This is my tried and true running shoe. Light enough to go fast, soft enough to go far while still being stable.
review.name: THE shoe

review.reviewBody: Very nice project, suggestion is specific cussing in nee area and light weight products
review.name: If necessary I will purchase again and again

review.reviewBody: After my wife talked non-stop about her new Hokas, I decided to join her in footwear paradise by getting a pair of my own. Wow- just...WOW! I have never had such comfortable shoes. I am creating excuses to wear them at every opportunity. I set multiple alarms during the night just so I can get out of bed, bust out my Hokas, and walk down the street to the all-night Quickie Mart for snacks.
review.name: Like walking on pillows!

review.reviewBody: Before these shoes working gave me a really bad pain under my feet but now the pain is gone. They are so comfortable!
review.name: They feel awesome

review.reviewBody: I love my new Clifton 9 shoes. Super comfortable and supportive. Hoka's are the best brand I've ever used. I would never go back to any other brand.
review.name: Fantastic shoes

review.reviewBody: Work standing all day and for first time my feet didn't hurt at end of day. Very comfortable shoes
review.name: Definitely buy again

review.reviewBody: Great for walking. It feels like you're walking on air.
review.name: Most Comfortable Sneaker Ever

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is amazing!! I love that its multi-layed. I typically buy Mens med as I like the fit better than womens size jackets. Im 5'5 small/med build and it fits perfect! The interior jacket is warm enough to wear on its own. Very cool design!
review.name: would highly recommend this jacket!

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: In my opinion, the ThermoBall Snow Triclimate jacket is one of the most versatile and functional jacket in the TNF line. It is essentially a 3 in 1 ensemble able to encounter any weather condition. This jacket will keep you dry, warm and protect you from the elements. The jackets design is conducive to any wilderness and urban activities.
review.name: Absolutely! This is my second "Tri Clim" jacket.

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This jacket cannot keep me warm for anything below 5C, Need to layer up to be warm in negative numbers. Would not recommend it be used as a everyday wear winter jacket. Planning to return it.
review.name: Not warm if you want it to be your winter jacket

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my second North Face Triclimate jacket, and it's just as impressive as the first! The 3-in-1 design is incredibly versatile-perfect for all seasons. I love how the outer shell keeps me completely dry during rain or snow, while the inner layer provides excellent warmth on cold days. The fit is spot-on, with enough room for layering without feeling bulky. The materials are durable and handle outdoor activities like hiking and skiing effortlessly. It's also stylish enough for everyday wear. If you're looking for a jacket that can adapt to any weather and last for years, the Triclimate is worth every penny. Highly recommended! Rating: ★★★★★
review.name: "Outstanding Versatility and Comfort" This is m

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is amazing. I live in Maine and have yet to experience weather cold enough to require both layers. Even during winter ascents I usually just have the outer jacket on. I highly recommend this jacket.
review.name: Great jacket for the cold weather

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this coat three years ago. It's still amazing. Keeps me warm, but lets me vent heat if I'm too warm. Inner jacket is also stylish for warmer days. I recommend.
review.name: Coat is awesome

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: With this jacket you get 3 styles in 1. I've been buying triclimates for years now; they are durable, comfortable and warm!
review.name: 3 in 1 Greatness

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: While the jacket is a little on the heavy side, it's super light without the insulated first layer. It's probably the best/most complete jacket I've ever owned. So far, I'm loving it!
review.name: Sick Jacket! #WorthIt

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great jacket for cold months and can be used also for spring time!
review.name: Very versatile

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought my first Triclimate Jacket in Spring of 2005. It lasted me until winter of 2023. I used the jacket heavily between Snowsports and everyday wear from the Michigan to Oregon. The shell finally started to fail in the waterproofing and zipper. The North Face warranty department was unable to fix the jacket and replaced it with the above jacket. I have not been able to use this jacket due to receiving it in August but can't wait to use it this winter.
review.name: Updated jacket

name: ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket - Men's
The North Face Men's ThermoBall Eco Snow Triclimate Jacket  | GH Review

review.reviewBody: Great base layer. Incredible warmth to weight ratio. Quarter zip is perfect for letting out some heat if it builds up. Slim fit by design.
review.name: Pricey but worth it

review.reviewBody: My first love is hoodies, but this one moves up to the front of the line for my light fleece tops. My first R1 Air loved it so much, bought another. I got a prior season color (blue on blue) that I really like for a discount, but paid full price for in-season color since I love the top so much. I've worn by itself on cool evenings/mornings and once as a mid-layer on a cold evening walk. very effective on its own or as a layer - warms up nicely when active but doesn't overheat.
review.name: Comfortable and Fits Well

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a lightweight fleece for my winter morning runs in Sacramento.  Something that is good for the 40s.  This fleece worked great and is as advertised in that it kept me warm even when I was sweating.  Patagonia has always been a challenge for me size-wise, but the large works well on my "I used to be fit, but now enjoy too many IPAs" body.  I sometimes wear a medium with Patagonia, but I think this cut would be too small for me.
review.name: Great for my morning run

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 25% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody: Wanted to really like it but a little too snug for me. I wanted to wear a thinner base layer underneath and this as a mid-layer but not enough room for my liking. Had to return it. 4 stars due to sizing.
review.name: Nice 1/4 zip

review.reviewBody: This sweater is great for winter. It keeps me warm during cold and windy days in Chicago. However, this definitely runs small. I usually wear a size S in most brands including Patagonia. But a size M was the perfect fit for me.
review.name: Great sweater for winter but runs small

review.reviewBody: I was skeptical about buying this fleece based on the reviews on this website, but I decided to give it a chance. It fits perfectly. It runs slim, but it's supposed to run slim to wick away moisture. I haven't had a chance to use it on hikes yet but it doesn't seem overly warm if worn casually. I have a better sweater and a capilene air and it's somewhere in between the two on terms of warmth.
review.name: Great lightweight performance fleece

review.reviewBody: I do not recommended it
review.name: Fits to small

review.reviewBody: I'm confused by the R1 Air and haven't decided the best use or combination for me yet.  Patagonia lists it as a baselayer to midlayer.  Wearing it as a baselayer, I felt it did not wick sufficiently to be a baselayer.  I felt the between areas of the zig-zag weaving where it breathes was fine, but sweat was accumulating at the zig-zag weave so it wasn't wicking sufficiently to wear as a baselayer.  One person's breathability is another person's wind penetration, which makes it a cold midlayer without a wind resistant/proof outer layer.  Most recently I wore lightweight baselayer, the R1 Air zip neck, and R1 techface on a hike in 18F-20F temp, and felt it was comfortable with exertion.  above 20F I had to take off the R1 Air and just wore the lightweight baselayer and R1 techface.  I also tried another hike in same temp range wearing just the R1 Air zip neck under a Nano-Air hoody and that was too warm and the R1 Air zip neck wasn't working well as a base layer.  I feel it is on the bulky side for packing.  I'm not sure how I will use it given its air permiability/breathability and its packing bulkiness.  It's sort of like The North Face's 50/50 line, which I also find perplexing.  On one hand its breathable because of the gaps, on the other hand it is cold because of the gaps.  Conversely, it can get too warm where there aren't any gaps.  Last,  I wish there were thumb loops.
review.name: not entirely sold

review.reviewBody:
Torso isn?t as bulky as the full zip version with the hood. Make no sense but palo green is a really nice in person. 

Very warm even though it breathes well. Very niche. 

I run warm so I can use it below 20F over baselayer or as a baselayer because it?s so tight.
review.name: Fits better than the full zip

name: R1 Air Zip-Neck Top - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I ordered the white one in L (I'm 5'2", 130)...the sleeves were very long but the strangest part was that the chest and shoulders were tight and the waist was looser but short in the front.
I'm not big busted...just seemed to pull in strange places.
The material may be waterproof but felt cheap.
I'm sorry to write such a negative review....just seemed not worth the money.
review.name: strange fit - not worth the $$
comment: With most cycling clothes, they are tailored specifically to fit well on the bike and will feel tight or strange if you are just standing around in them. Did you try it on the bike?

review.reviewBody:
The fabrics work well together. The windproof material doesn't breathe (you can't push your breath through it), but the mesh sections vent excess heat and moisture well. Riding in 55-65 F with combination of sun and shade, I was able to keep the jacket on till I started climbing above 65, while wearing a light long-sleeve jersey with no baselayer.

The zipper is excellent. Despite the gossamer construction the zipper doesn't snag. Unfortunately, it's not a double zipper, and there are no pockets or flaps to access jersey pockets.

Tailoring is a little off. Medium Castelli tops fit me snugly, and this fit as expected across the chest and shoulders, and was good on the arms. But wearing a light long-sleeve jersey will cause the crease of the elbow to be tight. Not enough to cut off circulation, but enough to be a little concerned about popping a seam. Less an issue with a short-sleeve jersey.

Castelli tops are always a little long in the torso for me, and this jacket even more so. I have to fold the front over so there isn't a large pouch of excess fabric at the belly.

For rides in a somewhat narrow temperature range, I think this jacket is better than a comparable vest and/or arm warmers. Packs extremely small and light.
review.name: Well designed

review.itemreviewed: GORE-TEX WINDSTOPPER Hybrid Touring Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Are these really a Men's item?  Shame on me for not reading reviews before cashing in on what seemed like a sweet end of season deal.  When I got them I tried them on.  Loved the price, loved the style, loved the color, loved the material, loved the fit.  Put them in my bag for the summer.  Just wrapped my first ski outing of the new season and I feel like I've been had.  Number one issue - No front zipper for the men to relieve themselves without taking off all of your upper outer gear and pulling down the bibs.  Huh?  How could you overlook this?  Second issue - the suspenders are useless and pop off with just the slightest body movement.  My real intention was to use these for snowmobiling on warmer days.  There's no way I'm doing that.  It would turn a quick trailside pit stop into a 15 minute dressing room session.  Remove helmet, remove neck brace, remove jacket, remove impact vest, remove top of bibs.  Have a go.  Get really cold.  Pull bibs back up, grab the rest of the outerwear out of the snow that was once piled on your snowmobile seat but has since slid off while you struggled with the terrible suspender closures.  Get even colder.  Brush off each piece of outerwear.  Put impact vest back on, then jacket, then neck brace, then helmet.  Realize that your friends have already left you behind for a couple miles now...  I would return these if I could but 9 months have passed.  They seemed great until put to a practical test.
review.name: BEWARE MUST READ BEFORE BUYING

review.itemreviewed: GORE-TEX WINDSTOPPER Hybrid Touring Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Contrary to other reviews, I think this is a great piece. Its described as a soft shell touring piece, it's not Goretex Pro hard shell. It's not meant to be waterproof in the worst conditions. Its meant to be breathable, flexible, comfy - which it 100% is! 

I use these for touring and resort days in good/fair weather & warm spring days. The material is SO comfy and breathable. Its also warm, I can run just baselayers and a light midlayer. I love my Goretex Pro pieces, but the feel is essentially a garbage bag, great for storm days, but when its fair weather I'd rather be in this! 

In regards to the suspenders, I have had no issues with the snap buttons whatsoever. The only issue, WHICH IS FIXABLE, is the suspender hook and loop attachments. They don't have a large vertical "hook" portion which others noted cause them to detach from the loop. I just took my leatherman's needle nose pliers and bent the hook portion up/closer to the body of the attachment. Smaller gap = No detaching. Super simple, easy fix. The lack of a fly is whatever, these rock!
review.name: A Great Specialized Piece

review.itemreviewed: GORE-TEX WINDSTOPPER Hybrid Touring Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I wanted to love these pants so much.   The color choices, design, materials, and look of them seemed impressive.   When they arrived, I immediately tried them on in hopes they would not have the issues that so many others complained about.  Unfortunately, they are indeed a big let down.   I dont know how a designer would let these issues go unresolved before sending them to market.   The rear suspender snap doesnt barely hold with any type of pressure.  Even bending over caused the suspender snap to pop apart.   The front suspender attachment is also an absolute joke and simply pops off with just basic movement.   No way would I rely on these while skiing in the backcountry.   It's a very small suspender with no durability at all.    I liked everything else about the pants, but the suspenders are literally what holds up the entire set and I wasnt going to have that constant problem.   I am surprised there is no pee zipper, but I could of lived with that.  Returned for full refund.   

IMO, when you put your logo and name behind a pair of your own bespoke gear, you need to make sure and do it right.   BC has done it right with other gear, so I am so confused about the problems these bibs have.   Unfortunately this was a big miss.
review.name: Big let down

review.itemreviewed: GORE-TEX WINDSTOPPER Hybrid Touring Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love the fit…. I love the material…

There is no zipper to quickly pee, so if you wanna pee you gotta take the jacket off, put it down… etc. I can live with that and I’ll chalk that up to my fault for not realizing it when I ordered….

The bib straps tho…. Are… infuriating…. They went to all this effort to make such a nice piece of clothing and then the hook to attach the over shoulder strap to the bib is like it’s designed to pop off constantly… bend over to buckle your boot? Strap pops off… reach over to get a sandwich out of your friends pack? Strap pops off… sit down? Strap pops off.  Sooooo annoying that now I am on the lookout for the worlds tiniest clip or caribeaner to replace it… or maybe just sew them on permanently, because otherwise, they are great!
review.name: I want to love these pants

review.itemreviewed: GORE-TEX WINDSTOPPER Hybrid Touring Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is the first Backcountry brand product I have bought. I think the workmanship and quality is great. I will consider Backcountry brand in the future, but I will look very closely at them. These bibs are actually a GREAT design. They are simple, good pocket and zipper placements, nice fit and unique mesh chest pocket to stash skins, AND a drop seat. Very Nice! The problem is I didn't realize they are NOT waterproof, they are water "resistant". Huh? You do realize snow is frozen water, right? Even in Spring conditions, in the backcountry you will get wet, maybe more so if temps are above freezing. Plus points for the drop seat for real backcountry use, but... no front zipper? Perhaps TMI, but I do believe I am more likely to use that than the drop seat :-) My wife asked me if I bought the women's version by mistake.  I am leaving this review because there was no option for comments when I returned my purchase.  Please re-release these bibs with waterproof material and a front zipper, then you have a killer set of bibs.
review.name: Almost great, but NOT!

review.itemreviewed: GORE-TEX WINDSTOPPER Hybrid Touring Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
When I saw these on sale for $172 it felt like a no-brainer, and at that price, I can not find anything that competes, which is what has kept me from returning the bibs, but they do have their quirks. 

Ill start with the positives, as they are certainly there. These bibs are comfortable, super dynamic in ventilation with the side zips, and waterproof enough to keep me as dry in north carolina blowers as I was in colorado. The pockets are nice, and the yellow is super cool looking, but that is where the positives stop. 

As has been posted by other reviewers, there is no fly. Personally thats not that big of a deal as i cant ever stay hydrated enough to need to pee while skiing anyways, but does seem like a pretty big design flaw for a backcountry pant. The strap connectors are laughable - for a company that has put out some really high quality gear, im surprised they would use such an annoying connector as it was obvious on first glance they would not work well, and they come disconnected ALL THE TIME. This was solved with some thread, and a needle, permanently attaching the straps but shouldn't have to be done for them to be functional, and i tried hooking them both ways. 

All in all for the cyber monday sale price of $172, ill keep them and overlook their quirks, as they are functional, comfortable, and dont make me look like a totally jerry; but at the retail price of $429 this is a laughable and insulting offering from backcountry that needs to hit the design stage again.
review.name: ok for sale price, laughable at retail

review.itemreviewed: GORE-TEX WINDSTOPPER Hybrid Touring Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I purchased a medium after measuring and comparing to the size chart. I came in solidly at medium to upper medium based on the chart. When I put them on, they are like wearing a garbage bag around my waist. Would not be good for touring as advertised. 
-no zipper fly??
- suspenders attachments are cheap, they came off easily when bending over.
Returning
review.name: Sizing is off and ineffective suspenders

review.itemreviewed: GORE-TEX WINDSTOPPER Hybrid Touring Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice fabric and features, cool pockets for skins and beacon. But no fly on the Men's bib? They do have a nice drop seat design, so if you squat to pee these would probably be great. But if you stand to pee, like many potential purchasers of this bib, these are truly weird. Returning unused :(

hasVariant.name: TRS Plus All-Terrain Gen 3 27.5in Tire - No Packaging
hasVariant.description: Buy the e*thirteen components TRS Plus All-Terrain Gen 3 27.5in Tire - No Packaging online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: TRS Plus All-Terrain Gen 3 27.5in Tire - No Packaging
review.reviewBody: I finally have had a chance to test the tire in good technical terrain to assess its capabilities.  Initially, I was surprised of how low of pressure I needed to drop to get the balance traction, rolling capabilities, and comfort on my steel hard tail.  Once I fine tuned the carcass to my riding style, it has become very capable tire.  Not as grippy as other softer compounds I have run and doesn’t roll as easily when knocking out the miles on smoother terrain, but is does show minimal wear after a ride on some very aggressive rocky terrain.  I have yet to ride the tire in highly wet conditions.
review.name: Solid, aggressive profile enduro tire

review.itemreviewed: TRS Plus All-Terrain Gen 3 27.5in Tire - No Packaging
review.reviewBody: OK, so they were a great deal on Backcountry, so I bought 2 to try them. $20/ea, definitely worth a try. Turns out, they're great tires! I bought 2 more! I rip thru tires so, I'm stocked up! I do prefer 2.6 wide, but the 2.4 isn't noticeable from a performance standpoint.
review.name: Great trail tire

review.itemreviewed: TRS Plus All-Terrain Gen 3 27.5in Tire - No Packaging
review.reviewBody: These fit well and look great! Price was awesome!
review.name: Look great!

name: TRS Plus All-Terrain Gen 3 27.5in Tire - No Packaging

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is very convenient to take a camera and a sport camera and batteries
review.name: Pretty good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great bag. I purchased a second as a gift. I kinda wished I got the bigger one to fit my bigger body camera kit but I’m using this bag with the laptop cover to its fullest potential. Feels durable and secure and doesn’t look like a typical camera bag. Which is everything I wanted.
review.name: Solid bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use this bag as my everyday carry for work. It has more than enough space for my every day essentials and feels very comfortable carrying over my shoulder.
review.name: great bad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this bad for my beginner photographer husband for Christmas. He has loved it so far and it fits his camera and all accessories. It even has a great place to put a tripod. It looks stylish and perfect for the outdoors. We are using it in Sedona this week and it’s been amazing!
review.name: Perfect Camera Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Unbelievable quality! Great product for going light with you kit
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Rogue 6L Sling is a functional bag that can hold small a DSLR/Mirrorless camera by itself , or a small camera and a couple of lenses with pockets to include accessories.
review.name: Rogue 6L Sling

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Exactly what I was looking for to accommodate my photo gear.
review.name: Rogue Sling Review

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The bag is very well made. It was too small. My Nikon Z7II and lenses (even one) wouldn't fit, and even with my small Nikon Zfc and lens the fit was too tight. The problem is that adding interior dividers for storage of accessories, reduces the capacity of a bag for its main purpose, namely, holding a camera and lens(s). I decided to go with a Domke sling; fewer pockets and dividers but more space.
review.name: Rouge 6L sling

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son asked for this as a gift. He gushed with praise for this bag. So many pockets, lightweight, room for everything, and great colour and style. He’s a future photojournalist!
review.name: Big hit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently bought a Rogue 6L Sling in Black. I had originally ordered the 9L but found that it was too big for me. Wandrd reps were extremely helpful in assisting me with the exchange. The 6L is the perfect size for my camera and 2 lense, extra battery, cable, car keys, etc. It is extremely well made, adjustable, and comfortable. Love the tripod/water bottle expandable pouch on the bottom. Definitely enough space without being bulky, I am 5’4”, and small frame.
review.name: Rogue 6L Sling

name: ROGUE 6L Sling Bag

review.reviewBody: I love the color and cut. The fabric is very lightweight, great for when it's hot and humid but a little delicate, has pulls after three washes. I'm 135 lbs, 5'6", and the small fits well.
review.name: Happy customer

review.reviewBody: This fabric pulls on literally everything. First time wearing it and it had a big pull on something that wouldn't have pulled anything else in my closet.
review.name: Fabric Pulls at Slightest Thing--

review.reviewBody: The fabric is so comfortable and nice for outdoor activities, it would be sick if they made a scoop neck version of this tank.
review.name: I'll probably by another

review.reviewBody: I ordered three of these for photo safari. Used one gardening and everywhere it touched a shrub is a pull.  I see now that Backcountry does not stand behind defective merchandise.
review.name: The Fabric Pulls Horribly

review.reviewBody: Warmer than I expected in fabric texture and more shear than anticipated. Again, I like the color option as a change up from the typical colors.
review.name: More shear than anticipated.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This top is awesome! The fit and cut is exactly how I hoped it would be. I'm usually between a medium or large in TNF, went with the large and it fits perfectly. Really like that the logo is tonal so it is more subtle. Material is an interesting waffle that is kind of heavy but works well for the style. Overall really great tank and going back to get it in more colors!
review.name: Such a cute top!

name: Sunpeak Waffle Tank Top - Women's

review.reviewBody: Very soft and warm. The fit is perfect for my body type and the materials are confortable and durable.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and warm, great for lounge wear, running errands, or to relax in after a long day on the mountain.

review.reviewBody: Love the pants. However I don't know why they took the pad off the butt but kept the pads on the knees. The Butt pad is important. they are still great pants

review.reviewBody: A year ago I purchased the Denali blue pants. They are great however I didn't notice that the brown ones I got have the knee pads but NOT the butt pad. review.reviewBody: Awesome! I purchased this together with the fleece hoodie. A great combination.

review.reviewBody: I've used this for years in my camper.  It works fine, keeps coffee hot, but I tossed the reusable filter a long time ago - too slow and messy.  I'd love to know what size to buy instead #4? #6?
review.name: Good insulation but filter too slow
comment: You can use #4 or 6, it doesn?t really matter.   But if it?s too slow, you might be better off adjusting your grind.  I tried paper filters for a while but it didn?t make much difference.   Having said that, I went back to the included cloth filter and pour the water faster and fill the upper cone to nearly the rim.  It works better that way.  This is my favorite way to make camp coffee.  I don?t like press.

name: Java Drip - 50oz

review.reviewBody: The material is nice and light and cut well, but it runs a bit small I would say. As the other reviewer said if you are at the top end of a M…..probably want to pass. I also have a 23in/58cm head and this thing is on the borderline of uncomfortably tight and I'm a skinny someone who normally wears Castelli!

review.reviewBody: According to the size chart (which is for helmets and might or might not apply to hats), I am at the top end of M. For the different helmets, M goes up to 23, 23.25, or 23.5" head circumference. My head is 23". This hat does fit onto my head, but it is tighter than I'd like. An L would be better. I may have to cut the elastic in a few places to lessen the pressure.
review.name: M is too small for me

review.reviewBody: Perfect love seat for sporting events or camping.  The wrap around bag makes it easy to pack up and smaller than most love seats.
review.name: Great love seat

review.reviewBody: Got this and expected it to be awesome but didn’t expect it to be the best chair ever
review.name: Game changer

review.reviewBody: Loving the loveseat. Comfy for two tall adults or kids and adults. I like that it is low to the ground easier to get comfortable in my opinion. I am 5’11” and find this very comfortable as does my partner who is 6’3”. Also bought at 50%off which was nice
review.name: So comfy

review.reviewBody: Great seat! Comfortable and easy to pack for kids games or sitting by the campfire
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: If you love lounging on the couch at home you'll love lounging on this couch while camping. The quality is top notch and you're friends who forgot their camp chair will be thankful you brought an extra spot for them to lounge, too.
review.name: Camping Couch

review.reviewBody:
I?ve always loved low short camp chairs and snuggling my dogs. I purchased the low down love seat and the low down chair. We took them out camping and our friends and their dogs ended up sitting in them more than we did. Next camp trip, they had bought their own! When I go solo, it?s a great couch for all out lounging and reading.
Very durable, they?ve seen some sparks from the fire, and a lot of very dirty dogs. They hold up, stay stable and brush off nicely. The carrying bag with padded handle makes packing up and unloading easy. Extra large cup holders mean I can hold my large water bottle or my coffee mugs with handles, and there?s a divider for holding cans. 
Really love this loveseat! The lowdown chair is great too. Very comfortable both for short and long legs! I?d buy again.
review.name: Our friends and dogs steal it everytime

name: Low Loveseat Camp Chair

review.reviewBody: Was guiding a school program where all the students were using these. Had one of guideline loops rip off and the stitching around the snow skirt seemed thin, some of them started to tear. Now, I do live on the coast and we were camping in some of the hardest conditions possible. (0°C HST 40cm) The water equivalency of that snow is high!

review.reviewBody: As a dedicated winter shelter the snow flaps, meshed peak vent and adjustable upper zipper vent are great additions over the regular Mega Light. hasVariant.name: BaseWash
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nikwax BaseWash online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been using Basewash on my cycling shorts.  Works great cleaning residual chamois creme from the pad.

If you're like me, you spend a lot on high-quality outdoor clothing, and spend a lot of time in that clothing training. This is my go-to for washing just about everything related to training, except DWR treated items and down outerwear. This does a great job of removing the stink and keeping technical wicking clothing doing what it should.
review.name: A great all-around wash for athletic clothing

review.reviewBody: I love to use this to wash baselayers and smelly gym clothes.  My first purchase I got a small bottle, but I use it so much igot a big bottle this time.
review.name: Great product.

review.reviewBody:
Got a 300mL bottle to try with an assortment of gym clothes (including Dri-FIT & UA), riding breeches and synthetic base layers. 

Thanks to having at least one ancestor that was a Wookie, I am a hairy, sweaty beast. As a result, this usually means that my gym & sports clothing don't smell great by the time they get home. 

I'm happy to report that this base wash does a stand-up job of exorcising these odors and keeping them fresh and maintaining their moisture-wicking and quick-dry properties. Once this ran dry, I picked up a 1L as this has become a staple for these garments.
review.name: Solid Workhorse for Active Wear and Base Layers

review.reviewBody: This stuff is great for cleaning that seasonal base layer gear.  it works as intended and directed and seems to do the trick for the years I have been washing my base layers with this wash.  the only "issue" I have with all the Nikwax products is the load ratio (i.e. max 6 items per load, etc.) with an active family and lots of base layers to wash, I can go through this product quickly.  you wont be dissappointed.
Works great with SmartWool products. I was the driest man on the mountains today.
review.name: Good product

review.reviewBody: The base wash got rid of all the soil and contaminants in my snow shell and brought back the water repellant nature of my coat, eliminating the need to use additional products.
review.name: Great cleaner

review.reviewBody: This is a great product for cleaning your waterproof ski outerwear. I only wash my shells a few times a season, but they came out noticeably cleaner.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: I love and swear by Nikwax products to keep my outdoor apparel in top condition throughout the seasons. Basewash is my favorite synthetic garment washing detergent, but it's too costly to use in my weekly laundry routines.
review.name: Great product that should be offered in even larger quantities

review.reviewBody: Works great on my dry-fit shirts. Removes odors and keeps my shirts smelling fresh.
review.name: Base Wash

name: BaseWash

review.reviewBody: I ordered the lavender heather men's essential shirt on sale and loved the fabric/fit so I wanted a few more colors. I bought the manzanita, grey heather, black, and calcite shirts and found that the solid colors (manz, calcite, and black) had different fabrics than both heather shirts. The solid colors' fabrics are super thin while the heather colors' fabrics have a bit more weight to them, which was the reason I enjoyed the original lavender so much. I am disappointed in the quality of the solid colors but am keeping the heather.
review.name: Different fabrics for different colors

review.reviewBody: Really nice. Fits good, looks good. Feels comfortable in the heat. The only thing is this is the type of fabric that seems to hold stink a little bit.
review.name: Very comfortable shirt

review.reviewBody: I bought 4pc of this products and love to wear them because of the following reasons; - very light material - fabrics that are very comfortable to the touch
review.name: Love this product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Shirt feels great and the material is perfect for all kinds of activities. Fits well according to typical sizes.
review.name: Want More!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was looking for some hot weather t-shirts that could be worn in casual and/or active settings. These shirts are great! They are lightweight and do a pretty good job wicking moisture and keeping you dry. I have this shirt in multiple colors, and would absolutely recommend them. I am typically an XL but bought these in XXL for a looser fit and am glad I did. I would absolutely recommend these shirts.
review.name: Favorite shirts

review.reviewBody: This is my favourite shirt it looks good while being athletic and light. Can wear around or to work out and has a great fit.
review.name: Amazing shirt

review.reviewBody: I've been using the Essential Tee for a few months now, and it truly lives up to its name. It's a great shirt for travel, as it wicks sweat without getting stinky, but still looks good with a pair of jeans. I can also reduce my packing by using it for daily wear one day and a run the next day. When I'm not traveling, I've used it as a workout shirt for running, weight lifting, and yoga - the dialed in fit and the material make it versatile for most activities across a range of conditions.
review.name: "Essential" - the name says it all

name: Essential Pocket T-Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: Ordered the Cross Hike 2 Mid Gore-Tex and they feel, fit, and look phenomenal! Great quality and finish, no blemishes at all. Got them on an amazing holiday sale, making it even better. I will come back to provide a durability review once I have worn them long enough.
review.name: Amazing Deal and Product!

review.itemreviewed: Cross Hike 2 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite shoes. Great around the house, out running errands or doing my favorite walks and hikes.
review.name: Love em

review.itemreviewed: Cross Hike 2 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: i purchased and was to tight same size as last pair returned and no longer available waiting for good sale on simular  pair
review.name: returned

review.itemreviewed: Cross Hike 2 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable and waterproof.  Does what it's supposed to do.
review.name: Good shoes & waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Cross Hike 2 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've bought Salomon before. Shoe size has never been an issue. Until now products I've purchased have been great; that's why I keep coming back. However this shoe fits smaller and I live outside the USA, so there's no way I can return them.
review.name: Size fits 1/2 smaller
comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: Cross Hike 2 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: They are slim, light and comfy. Only complaint is they are not as warm as I had hope. Ordered a pair of 9.5, the right foot fits perfectly but left one is a bit loose. This had never happened to me with other shoes and my first pair of Salomon's, so there seems to be a little size discrepancy when they were made.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.itemreviewed: Cross Hike 2 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this boot for hiking in the Azores. Held up really well and my feet were comfortable and dry. I had a couple people I came across ask me what kind they were too.

review.reviewBody: I’ve done about 10 rides with these now varying between 30 and 100 miles.  The basics: 6’2” 210 lbs, athletic, bought a size large. Nice fit, true to size, comfortable against the skin, not the nicest stitching, but perfectly acceptable at this price. Really nice weight and warmth for cool to cold conditions. Shoulder straps not the most comfortable, chamois is good, not great.  If I’m going more than about 90 minutes I’ll wear a different pair. I would recommend these if you are on a budget, won’t go long distance, or won’t need tights very often.  If you need to wear tights a lot, spend a little more and get a better chamois.
review.name: Solid Tights (for the money)

review.reviewBody: Was looking for a slightly heavier bib tight. These fit nicely, true to size, and aren’t too long for shorter men (5’6”, 148#, US medium). The chamois was a little stiff until the first wash. Overall a nice bib, especially when on sale
review.name: Nice bibs

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'6" and 135 Lbs wearing small size. It's perfectly fit to my body. Fabric is soft and comfortable next to skin. It's so easy to wear. I have been using it for a couple of times this fall already in the weather, around 55-60 F° and Windy Day.  40 miles round trip both times. Very warm, very comfortable. Bib chamois pad is very comfortable. I plan to buy another same one or try C5.
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: it is a great product, and I am very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody:
Im 6 foot 2, 190 lbs, and the XXL fits perfect. They are warm for chilly California weather (40-60 F). I wore them on a 100 mile ride (6 hours) and the chamois was great, no soreness or saddle sores. 

The only thing i dont like is that there are some loose threads near one of the ankles.
review.name: I love them

review.reviewBody: These bike tights are the worst. I purchased these for winter riding the the pad does not stay in the right place. The resulted in an uncomfortable ride on a few occasions.
review.name: Terrible

review.reviewBody: The seams and overall comfort of these bibs are great. Had a metric century ride that started at 42F and ended at 68F, was super comfortable for the entire ride. The chamois is one of the simplest, yet most comfortable i have used. These seem to be more of an "american" fit which is good for me.
review.name: Great spring/fall bibs

name: C3 Thermo Bib Tights+ - Men's

review.reviewBody:
My 8yo got into mountain biking.  When he hits the trails with me, I make him wear a full-face helmet.  I knew he would complain about wearing a full face helmet if it wasn't super comfortable.  He really likes the helmet.  He went over the bars last summer and the helmet kept him protected.  Given that I don't let him remove the chin guard when on the trail, I'll prob just buy a helmet without a removable chin guard when buying again.

He wears a Bontrager helmet as his tool around helmet in the neighborhood but likes to throw this one on when pulling out ramps.  

As a quick aside, while he is 8, he does fit the small size.  The helmet is true to the size guide.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody:
Bell Helmets typically fit my hard to fit head well, this one was no different. Fit my head great. However the cheek pads came at least an inch from my face and the extra pads included were the same exact size. Bell said they have other sized pads but you have to BUY THEM from a separate company-weber sports i believe- which is unacceptable to have to make a purchase from another company just to see if you can make the helmet fit safely. 

Also, chin bar seems super flimsy, like it would crack in half and potentially cause more harm. Might seem better with a more secure fit but not dealing with the hassle just to see if it fits safely. 

I ordered a M. The head part fits great, but cheek support is way off. Im female. Seems like they designed this helmet for a male jaw line.
review.name: Chin bar fit is not adjustable

review.reviewBody: I had a direct ground impact from a dirt jump going 20mph. I landed on top of my head. I went to the ER for a CT and MRI scans and everything came back normal. The ER doctors say that my helmet save my brain from severe damage. Thanks to the MIPS technology, i only suffered from a slight head contusion. It could of been a lot worst if it was any other helmet without MIPS. The top of my helmet was cracked which is ok with me! The helemts did it's job! I'm glad to buy a replacement which i did the very next day!
review.name: MIPS saved my life

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet for a weeklong mtb trip to Moab. I was worried that a full face was would be super hot and restrict peripheral vision. I rode in the desert sun all week and literally couldn?t tell a difference between it and a normal xc helmet, other than the fact that I felt much more confident doing all the drops and other crazy stuff. Like ten times I forgot the chin bar was there and bumped a snack into it trying to grab a snack LOL. Three friends who were on the trip with me tried it and have already ordered their own. So two thumbs up. Good work Bell!
review.name: Great Helmet - Highly Recommend!

review.reviewBody: Feels super light and airy but the chin guard doesn?t feel like it could take a hard hit. Most reviews pretty much state the same. Returning.
review.name: Flimsy Chin Guard

review.reviewBody: I have used this helmet for a bout 4 months now -- bought it for shuttle days, but it is so comfortable that I have treated it as my go to helmet for most of my riding. Just feels better having my full face protected. --- sometimes I remove the chin bar, but it is vented enough that I usually just leave it on. --- it is a great product.
review.name: light weight and breathable

name: Super Air R Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: Used this helmet to hike Black Tusk in British Columbia.  The fit was good.  Chin strap was a little annoying, but that is any helmet.
review.name: Great helmet for the cost

review.reviewBody: I guess you can always go lighter and more comfortable, but I often forget its up on my head. It just does the trick. The twist-adjuster is a huge time saver. Though I think that's probably a standard on everything now, IDK.
review.name: Reliable

review.reviewBody: This is a good basic climbing helmet. I use it primarily as a low-cost search and rescue helmet. I do notice, however, that the cradle easily becomes dislodged from the shell. The helmet also tends to slip some on contact. These are safety concerns, and should be kept in mind while making a purchase decision.
review.name: Good basic climbing helmet, with limitations

review.reviewBody: My first climbing helmet was this model. It's great for saving money and protecting the noggin! Not the lightlest, but good for cold days and covering your whole head compared to lighter weight models.
review.name: solid helmet at a fantastic price point

review.reviewBody: Provides excellent protection, especially at its price point, however it doesn't breathe at all and can be uncomfortable against the forehead. The clips hold a headlamp in place very well and I haven't had a problem with anything shifting. It fits well and stays secure in everything I've put it through.
review.name: Fantastic for the price.

review.reviewBody: Not much to it. Great helmet and moderately comfortable. Could use some tweaks in the clip that secures it under your chin, but overall nice helmet.
review.name: Great helmet

review.reviewBody: Durable enough to throw in/on a carry on bag without having to worry. I don’t mind or notice the weight compared to a super lightweight helmet, and am an intermediate level climber.
review.name: Durable helmet for travel

review.reviewBody: The helmet fits well and doesn't get in the way. I have used this outdoor rock climbing and tree ascension.
review.name: Comfortable and light enough

review.reviewBody: The only good thing about this: it's pretty much the only hard-shell climbing-rated helmet that goes to 63cm (critical if you need to wear a balclava or beany *and* have a larger head!). Which is still smaller than I'd like, but Petzl only go to 61cm, and Edelrid to 59cm. The design of the 3-point chinstrap makes it very unstable (especially on larger heads), and the nub on the back makes it impossible to hard mount a light with a battery box. These design choices make it wholly inapropriate for caving (as compared to Petzl's Boreo), and means I'm sticking with my Ecrin Roc.
review.name: Very unstable due to chinstrap design

review.reviewBody: This helmet is just right, heavy duty enough, yet light enough for a full shell helmet. Fits hoods both inside and outside well and doesnt interfere with my sunglasses. Its a winner!

name: Half Dome Helmet

review.reviewBody: I have had these for 3 years. The construction and materials are excellent, but the gloves simply do not keep my fingers warm.
review.name: Excellent Quality - but NOT warm

review.reviewBody:
Pros - great dexterity, nice construction and comfy fit in warm and dry conditions (25 degrees and up).
Cons - these gloves are not waterproof and not very warm. Even with ample amounts of the Hestra balm they will wet out in any type wet snow.  The material on the backside is a cloth type and will soak through.  If you ski Tahoe or the PNW, then look elsewhere unless you need some spring gloves.
review.name: Nice spring glove, not waterproof

review.reviewBody: Hestra is the premier glove maker and this glove lives up the highest standards of craftsmanship. The leather is buttery soft and the fit is great. The attention to detail is also top notch. They are the perfect ski glove in my opinion and you cannot go wrong with buying a Hestra glove.
review.name: The Best Gloves Ever!

review.itemreviewed: The Tube Dual Layer Facemask - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son loves this balaclava. He wants to wear it all the time. It's a little big for him because he's 3, but I'm sure it'll fit him perfectly by next winter. The only negative I have is that it often moves up to get into his eyes, but I think that's due to it being a little big. He says it keeps his face warm, and he feels like a ninja. The material feels thin but it's actually very insulating. It's also breathable at the same time.  I would recommend this, especially if you have a little whose face is always cold.
review.name: Nice material, keeps kid warm

review.itemreviewed: The Tube Dual Layer Facemask - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the warmth and softness of the balaclava.  It keeps my neck and face very nice and warm when I go skiing . It is not too think or bulky and first under the helmet
review.name: Comfy
comment: Thank you so much for your review! Happy to hear that you are enjoying it out on the ski hill this season.

review.itemreviewed: The Tube Dual Layer Facemask - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The order process was easy, the package came in a good time. The material on this neck warmer is very elastic, antimicrobial, breathable, dual layer thermal warmth. Machine washable. The item is comfortable and very durable. Anyway my daughter is not a big fan of this stuff because it's kind of long on her neck, it's just because this is also a helmet compatible face cover. If you are skiing this is supposed to be great for you. It's a soft stitch google interface. You can choose from some color options. It's one size item. I don't know if I would buy this stuff for my daughter, probably not.
review.name: Nice, soft material

review.itemreviewed: The Tube Dual Layer Facemask - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was so warm and so comfortable. My cousin plays winter sports and he absolutely loved this to keep warm when he was t running around. The fit was great, didn't irritate his skin it nose and said he could breathe just fine. Held up fine for sports so definitely durable and worth it's price.
review.name: Worth it and warm

review.itemreviewed: The Tube Dual Layer Facemask - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Both of my boys really liked black strap Tube Neck. Warmer they both said that it was comfortable, breathable and a nice snug fit. The material is stretchy yet soft.
review.name: Comfortable, breathable, soft and stretchy!

review.itemreviewed: The Tube Dual Layer Facemask - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I chose kids size over the adult size due to my small face shape. I recommend to anyone who likes hiking or running in a windy atmosphere. This is very comfortable to wear and I love how it also covers my neck. The warmth and breath ability are great.
review.name: Excellent outdoor gear

review.itemreviewed: The Tube Dual Layer Facemask - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is very comfortable to wear! This is a kids size but I have a slim, narrow face and it fits perfect.  I love how it also covers my neck. The warmth and breath ability are far superior than others I have tried!
review.name: Warm and breathable

review.itemreviewed: The Tube Dual Layer Facemask - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son really loves this neck warmer it’s very comfortable and it works really well! It keeps my son warm and it’s not bulky! Love the color and the fit , and the fabric is really good quality and breathable!
review.name: Great quality !!

review.itemreviewed: The Tube Dual Layer Facemask - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The neck warmer is very comfortable and the material is durable. I wished the branding was smaller and not rubber as my son said it bothered him. The material is very breathable and the black color goes well with all style of clothing. I will be curious how well the material will hold up after stretching it by wearing it.
review.name: Great neck warmer with a caveat

review.itemreviewed: The Tube Dual Layer Facemask - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great neck warmer for my kids. It’s very soft and comfortable to wear it fits well. Protects you from the wind and cold breeze in the winter weather.
review.name: Good quality

description: Buy the KEEN Chandler 2 CNX Hiking Shoe - Infants' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chandler 2 CNX Hiking Shoe - Infants'
hasVariant.description: Buy the KEEN Chandler 2 CNX Hiking Shoe - Infants' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have been buying Keens for my daughter almost exclusively and I typically love the quality and durability of the shoes. This shoe showed signs of wear and the bungee strap loop broke with one month of use. The toe piece is also separating from the fabric.
review.name: Not as durable as typical Keens

review.reviewBody: Nice and grippy, my kiddo loves these. Only issue is that they are different to put on.
review.name: Kid shoe

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves these. At first, they were a little tough to slip on, but that got better. She is used to a more barefoot style shoe, so I was worried these would be too stiff for her. But she seems to love them. Now I just have to hope they are durable enough after reading mixed reviews. We loved the old style chandler cnx when she was younger, so I really hope these hold up. So far, no complaints. I would say they run a little small, so if your child is on the line order up.
review.name: Comfortable and quick to put on

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My 2 year old grandson has wide feet. These shoes fit him perfectly!
review.name: Great shoe for active 2 year old

review.reviewBody: My little one has a high instep, though not outrageously high. It’s a struggle to put these CNX sneakers on, which effectively makes them not a go to sneaker, so they’re really not worth buying. Otherwise, they seem like a good sneaker, though haven’t worn them enough to see if they have any stamina.
review.name: Not a good fit for high instep feet

review.reviewBody: Sadly I can not recommend these shoes. My 4 year old and I were both very excited for them. However, they were too small even though I had measured correctly and they were very difficult for my son to take on and off. So sadly I had to return them.
review.name: Run small

review.reviewBody: I don’t like anything about this redesign. The old ones we bought religiously every six months for years since she was old enough to walk. The new ones have started to rip around the ankle part two weeks after purchase. Please bring back the old design!!!!
review.name: Newer Isn’t necessarily better!

review.reviewBody: The rubber at the toe began separating the second time my son wore them for casual play. Kids' shoes ought to be better, as should Keens.
review.name: Shoddy assembly > near instant degradation

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We love these shoes for my newly turned 3 year old. He can put them on easily himself, and I like that they're wider in the toe box and the sole is flexible and light. I do wish they'd make them closer to zero drop, but for the money, you just can't beat these for kids. We have four kids that are almost exclusively in Keen at this point. They are so high quality, they're great to pass from kid to kid. I love that they dry quickly and are washable. It's amazing that they can wear them for 30 days and still return if they don't like the fit. The rewards program is fantastic. I've already bought the next size up for my 3 year old while the color is on sale and I bought 2 other pairs in a different color for my 10 and 5 year olds that they're loving. Great shoe!
review.name: Already bought the next size up

review.reviewBody: Wow! These shoes are so versatile and durable. Perfect shoes for all my kids' summer activities - tree climbing, park swinging, rock throwing, dog walking, and more. The Chandler is super sturdy and looks very cool.
review.name: Perfect Summer Shoes!

name: Chandler 2 CNX Hiking Shoe - Infants'
