description: Buy the Outdoor Research Coldfront Down Beanie online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Coldfront Down Beanie
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Coldfront Down Beanie online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I absolutly love the hat, the color, the warmth and how soft it is.  BUT I CAN'T KEEP IT ON MY HEAD!!!  It's the right size but it still slips right up my hair.  If anyone knows how to fix this without using pins or headbands (I want to wear it skiing or to put on when I take off my snowmobile helmet) please please help me.
review.name: Slippage

review.reviewBody: I figured with this being a unisex product, the S/M size would work for me but it’s really small. It fits but it’s not the relaxed fit I was looking for so I probably won’t wear it as much. The color, quality, and warmth is great but I regret not ordering the M/L
review.name: Sizing is small!

review.reviewBody: I would not recommend to hike in the down beanie as you it will get drenched in sweat - but its great to wear for campsites or just a short hike. The size is a little small and it's not a very stretchy material.
review.name: Love the down beanie

review.reviewBody: My head is 22" around, and the Small/Medium fits perfectly. Not sure why this is listed under the men's category, but it can definitely fit women.
review.name: Measure your head circumference

review.reviewBody: I had this hat for years.  Well, I've had several versions of this hat for years because I keep losing them.  Like many of the reviewers, I get compliments when I wear it.  Don't know where the "ugliest hat' comments come from.  Also, it is warm and doesn't result in hat hair.
review.name: Love this hat

review.reviewBody: A disadvantage of my backpacking quilt was the lack of a 'hood'. I wanted a head cover that doesn't weigh much and is super warm! This fits the bill for both of those requirement!! And it packs down amazingly small, so doesn't take up any extra space in my pack! Of note is I bought the small first and switched to the large to cover my ears.
review.name: Perfect hat for my backpacking quilt

review.reviewBody:
I didn't wear the hat yet, i just tried it on. It runs small. 
I have the feeling that because of the material it will make it a little harder to hear - the material is noisy against the ear, in a way. Good quality.
review.name: Nice insulating Hat

review.reviewBody: I keep my head shaved. This Beanie Keeps my head nice and warm. I have some wool beanies and sometimes they are too much. This light weight beanie is just right. Great fit with a Xl for me.
review.name: Nice for a bald head

review.reviewBody: I got the XL/L beanie and you have to pull it all the way down to where your eyelids are in order for it to stay. If it goes up, it'll fly away in the wind. Wish I could return it but it will cost me $6.95 to return it back. Sigh.
review.name: doesn't stay on my head

review.reviewBody: Great little hat. Bought this special to go with my (hoodless) quilt. Really helps me sleep warm. Also great for chilly mornings around camp. My only complaint is it's not available in a larger XL size.
review.name: could use a larger size..

name: Coldfront Down Beanie

review.reviewBody: These pants are so unbreathable that it feels like you are wearing a plastic trash bag on your legs.  Went for a ~9mi hike in 40 deg and immediately had to zip into shorts mode.  Even with the legs zipped off I was sweating like crazy under there.  My legs will sweat even just sitting on the couch with them on.  I don't see myself being able to wear these in any situation.  It's really too bad because the fit is great and it's hard to find zip offs that aren't 9-11" long in shorts mode.  Build quality so-so.  Not sure I'll take any more chances with the Stoic brand.
review.name: Plastic bag pants, Nice fit

review.reviewBody: I know, heresy, right? But really, with small modifications, these can be just as good as yates, maybe even better. As reed showed, a light spreader mod to these is nice (mine isn't quite as involved, as I prefer to keep the rubberized surface available), and I also like sewing a loop of double sided velcro tape onto the bottom of the very bottom rung, so that I can either shorten the ladder or simply turn the whole thing into a very tight package that hangs from my harness nice and clean. Def the only ladder for tall people who like to clip high pieces, as you can cover some serious ground with these, compared to yates.
review.name: arguably as good/better than yates

name: Ladder Aider 1in

review.itemreviewed: Stem Mount for Garmin Computers - Adjustable
review.reviewBody:
The product is made very well and it's good to see replaceable parts for the plastic retainer.  The down side is that it doesn't have a universal fit, the washer is just too large to fit on my bike.  The fit is sloppy and doesn't stay in place once a longer screw was to get the fit to "work".

For reference I have a Specialized Roubaix Pro
review.name: High quality, bad fit

review.itemreviewed: Stem Mount for Garmin Computers - Adjustable
review.reviewBody: Did not fit on my bike, using this as the top spacer, there was too much angle and could not connect the garmin unit.  Had this installed off to the side of the stem but after the first crash the inner plastic holding the garmim broke away. Probably a strategic failure point so the garmin isn't broke, which is appreciated but the mount is now useless.
review.name: Like everyone else...

review.itemreviewed: Stem Mount for Garmin Computers - Adjustable
review.reviewBody: Straight forward and simple. A better mount than the traditional Garmin options, including the out-front handlebar mount when you're mounting this to a mountain bike. The only downside would be that you have to mount it at the top of your steerer tube for the computer (I have a 530) to mount. If you have any steerer tube length above this mount, it won't fit. I originally wanted the computer to be flush with my stem, but I had to leave an extra 5mm spacer under this mount for my computer to mount.
review.name: As described and worth it

review.itemreviewed: Stem Mount for Garmin Computers - Adjustable
review.reviewBody: I contacted my Gear Head and told them what bike I have and which computer I have. They said this would work with my setup. I installed the stem mount and immediately knew it would not work. You must have a flat stem or very little rise for this to work with the larger computers. I have an Edge 830.
review.name: Does Not Work on my bike

name: Stem Mount for Garmin Computers - Adjustable

review.reviewBody: My only dislike in the shoe is the shoe lace. Almost impossible to find replacement, even online direct from the company.  Very difficult to replace the lace package - I gave up and purchased a thin lace of rawhide.
review.name: Appealing style, light weight, nice fit

review.reviewBody: This is the third pair I’ve purchased. Nothing better for straightaway comfort . Wear them until they fall apart. They go through a great deal of hard work over their lifetime. Nothing else wears as well for me. I buy one size up as I walk long distances . Never experienced any trouble with blisters etc.
review.name: Excellent shoes

review.reviewBody: It rubs a little in some places, especially on the fingers, but I think it will go away with time.
review.name: Good overall

review.reviewBody: I’ve always been a fan of Salomon XA pro but they have never been amazing for my narrow feet. These shoes so far have great heel hold even with a aftermarket footbed (superfeet hike cushion). The heel pocket and mid foot fit well and the toe box has plenty of room for toes to do what they need to do.
review.name: Great Shoe for narrower feet!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are comfortable and offer good support. The lacing system offers great security
review.name: Good Hikers

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair, I wear them to work and they hold up well.  They provide really good ankle support and foot support.
review.name: light, comfortable and sturdy

review.reviewBody: Skipping the details of my experience, this shoe is  inferior to the GTX model priced somewhat above it. The tongues slipped to the outside always, the foot bed or maybe the sole construction, the sensation of feel seemed dull or wooden, the over all fit was loose, there was kind of an overall flimsy feeling. This is of course 100% subjective, my experience.  I'm not saying someone else wouldn't find them perfect; I hike in rough and rocky vertical places. Plus they aren't waterproof....Go for the GTX model.
review.name: The Wrong Shoe for me

review.reviewBody: they are good but the comfort could be better. They just feel like they have no cushion.
review.name: Pretty good
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.reviewBody: Purchased the X Ultra 4 after my previous Salomon’s had met their limit , 7 years of service. I expected the same when I purchased these and just about a year into wearing 1x to 2x per week for medium/ moderate day hikes (6-10 miles)  I expect these will last about 4 or 5 years .. Highly recommend this shoe, great support, comfortable and thus far as durable as my prior pair-  I believe a predecessor to the x ultra 4.
review.name: Perfect support and function

review.reviewBody: Started coming apart first day. cheap built don't waste your money
review.name: Started coming apart first day. Cheap made

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Can't wait to see our grandson in this when weather turns colder. I know and trust the quality of Columbia clothing. Grandpa has a matching red and black plaid jacket so am anxious to take special moment pictures!
review.name: Great purchase!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this for a baby shower. I had purchased a similar bunting a few years ago for another baby shower and the new mom said she absolutely loved this and used it frequently. We live in a mountain area where winters are snowy and cold. 
She commented that this bunting kept her little one cozy and warm.
review.name: Bunting makes a great baby shower gift

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for the in between winter/spring weather in Maine. Works well in the car seat. Seems to keep my boy comfortable and dry.
review.name: Just what I was looking for.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm, Comfortable for my 3 month young daughter .It was snowing & she felt all cozy in there .We did have another Columbia jacket on top of it though
review.name: Warm,Comfortable, Cozy in Snow

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The fit is true and perfect. The colors are spectacular warm and just as pictured.
review.name: Warm fleece

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Out of the package i thought the fleece was a little rough. After a wash it softened up. I think it is nice. I wish it had the zipper protector under the chin though.
review.name: Decent quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice bunting in a nice vibrant red. I like that both the hands and feet have the option of fold over fabric to keep them extra warm. It does run quite long, and we have a 1 year old already on the taller end of the spectrum. For now we just fold the sleeves and pant legs which is fine.
review.name: Great bunting but runs long.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We have a mild winter this year so far (NY). This bunting is our everyday go-to outer wear.
review.name: Perfect for this winter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits my 14 month old as expected and perfect layer for a chilly day
review.name: Perfect for a chilly day

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bunting is great for baby to wear safely while in his car seat. I bought it specifically for this reason. It is warm, cozy, and not too bulky. I got the 12-18 month suit for my 9 month old (22 lbs). I use the fold overs on the hands and feet when we’re in the car. It fits now, with some room to spare, so I think it will fit throughout the winter season.
review.name: Great for car seat

name: Snowtop II Bunting - Infant Boys'

review.reviewBody: Don’t expect to get more than a season out of this jacket. My 10 year old tried to zip his coat up today and the zipper broke off in his hand. Unfortunately this is considered “normal wear and tear” and not covered under 686’s warranty. I’ll steer clear of 686 in the future.
review.name: Fragile Zipper

review.reviewBody: We were excited to receive the new jacket (blue and red color way)! Upon closer look, I noted a few areas where the thread was already starting to pull out on the chest and armpit areas. Knowing our 5 year old is going to wear this, I can imagine how quickly these areas are going to snag.
review.name: Ok quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First off the colour is fantastic to see your child on the ski hill. Our 14 year old loves all the pockets to stash snacks and his phone. The super durable zipper doesn’t get caught in fabric. Now we are a 686 family. Not to mention the discount was very attractive.
review.name: Fantastic for snow sports

review.reviewBody: Bought this jacket and returned it twice.  Loved it nice and warm son loved how it looked, but the tab the zipper mated to broke off of both of the jackets.  The first jacket it broke after three wears, second time it only took two.
review.name: Great Bad Zipper

review.reviewBody:
Jacket itself is great. Zipper quality is marginal at least on the jacket I received for my kid 

But still worth buying another jacket
review.name: Initial jacket zipper broke.

review.reviewBody: This is a very well built jacket and looks great also
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: I ordered the hydra jacket for my son , he absolutely loves it! I purchased the lime green/ yellow colour. Great quality material and water proof zippers. Great jacket for a young snow boarder! Fits a bit big but not an issue as he will grow into it. Highly recommend!
review.name: Boys hydra camo jacket in yellow

review.reviewBody:
An awesome toasty warm jacket with great pockets n features.
Two items I feel were a miss: 
Needs Arm/Pit vents to regulate the heat.
Hood is too small to fit over boys helmet .
review.name: Perfect Very Warm Jacket needs Arm Vents

name: Hydra Insulated Jacket - Boys'

review.itemreviewed: Jungle Moc Frosty Waterproof Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody:
I bought the kids size jungke moc as I wanted waterproof and seems thoe are no longer available. 
Normal size 8 or 8.5. I use jungle mocs to work in the yard or alk the dog. Always have kept my feet dry. My old pair finally gave out. 

New ones are ok. They do keep my feet dry. Bought size 6.5 in 'big kids' equal to a women's 8.5. They are wider, looser then my old women's pair. They don't have the rubber that wraps up the front for scuffs. So these are good, but not great with regard to fit. 
Shoe quality is similar and maybe it is just that they are a bit too large. We have a hilly lawn and my feet slide forward and around. I am a b width typically. And need a wider toe box. Franco Sartos, Timberland, Clark's, Nine West, and tennis shoes New Balance 880s are preferred.
review.name: Similar to old ones, Women's Waterproof jungle moc

review.itemreviewed: Jungle Moc Frosty Waterproof Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: I love these shoes so much i bought another pair in blue the first pair was purple.
review.name: So nice I bought them twice
comment: Yay!  Thanks so much!

name: Jungle Moc Frosty Waterproof Shoe - Kids'

review.reviewBody: This is the 4th rope cling bag I have bought and I am so disappointed. I dont know what Kava is doing but the material is cheap and quality is low last one I will buy.
review.name: Lace Rope Sling

review.reviewBody: I ordered the Kavu for the first time.  I thought it was the large size on sale as the price was red and was listed with the larger one; instead I ordered the small size   Took off the tags and when I went to use it, it was too small for what I needed.  Now I have a mini sling kavu that I do not have a use for.  Kavu was quality made.
review.name: Kavu

review.reviewBody: wife uses it every day she rides here motorcycle. i have even used it myself. unisex for sure
review.name: great product

review.reviewBody: I love my black Kavu bag! It's bigger and it has with everything! I love the pockets especially!
review.name: Kavu bag

review.reviewBody: I have been looking for a sling bag for awhile.  I kept looking at this one but wasn't sure I liked the rope.  I actually talked to a woman who had one and she said she loved it and the ropes weren't a problem.  I bought this one and actually really like it.  There are only two things I think could be improved on:  first, I wish there was some sort of a clip or hook inside to hold my keys.  The zippers open the entire side of the bag up and I've had my keys fall out.  Second, I wish that the top pocket on the front was a bit bigger.  I have reading glasses and they don't quite fit.  The pocket could be a bit deeper.  Neither of those are deal killers but I do think they would improve the bag.  I do like that the bottom pocket on the front easily holds my  phone.
review.name: Happy with this bag

review.reviewBody:
Over a shoulder 100% of the time. Replaced purse, fanny pack, back pack, and almost anything I need to transport at the time. Material and construction excellent. When was the last time you had compliments from strangers?  Extremely practical yet very stylish. Glad I got it.😉
.
review.name: New full time carry

review.reviewBody: Couple issues - the thumb lining is not as long as the thumb's exterior lining. So while the index and other fingers fit just perfectly, the thumb pocket is extremely short. Then there is the grip. Not sure I can hold a ski pole, or much else, very well. Thumb and index finger work well but it feels like the other three-finger/mitten section isn't articulated in the correct way. They seem to squeeze separately and make gripping quite difficult. Seem like they would be warm enough, but since I can barely get my thumb in, not sure I will even get to try these out in the cold.
review.name: SADLY DOESN'T WORK THAT WELL

review.reviewBody: Purchased for my 4 year old. We used them in the mountains to play in the snow and his feet stayed dry. Great purchase.
review.name: Love!
comment: We love the great feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed Mid Waterproof Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: Bought these for my son and we have been on 2 hikes. The great steps at the Palisades and Rockefeller State Park. No complaints his feet stayed dry until he went ankle deep in the stream... Lol other then that he said they were okay. The only problem was the boots appeared to have a layer or skim that peeled from the bottom after the first hike. It was if it was a layer of paint that peeled off. But discoloration and the boots work as expected. If any change will up date and that's why I gave them 4 stars.
review.name: Short hikes moderate terrain
comment: We value and appreciate your feedback.
